title: 1 John: Walk in the Light
objective: Gain assurance of eternal life through right belief, obedient love, and fellowship with God.

required_passages.text: God is light... if we walk in the light... the blood of Jesus cleanses us... see what kind of love the Father has given... let us not love in word... but in deed and in truth.

segments.audio_script: John writes so believers may know they truly belong to God.

Listen to 1 John 1-3. John proclaims the incarnate Word of life and calls believers to walk in the light through honest confession and cleansing by Jesus' blood. He warns against worldliness and antichrist deception. He celebrates the Father's love that makes believers His children and commands practical love for brothers and sisters.
False teachers denied key truths about Jesus and unsettled believers' assurance.
Assurance is relational and evidential: right confession of Christ, ongoing repentance, and love in action. Grace produces transformed fellowship, not lawless indifference.
Key themes include assurance, confession, cleansing, identity as God's children, discernment, and practical love.
Reflect on this: Does your claim to know God show up in repentant honesty and practical love?
Walk in the light and love in truth. Next, 1 John deepens discernment and confidence in prayer and obedience.
